intro: Coreopsis ovata, commonly known as the narrowleaf coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the eastern and central United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in the summer months and are often used in garden landscapes for their vibrant color and drought tolerance. Coreopsis ovata is also valued for its ability to thrive in poor soil conditions and its role in supporting pollinators.
